entries.text:
This special throwing blade has a flat tip, and is wielded by guardians of the Church of Filianore.
Consume FP to project illusory blades which seek their targets. Scales with Luck.
Guardians of the Church, of whom few remain, watch over Princess Filianore's eternal slumber along with the Spears of the Church.

The Spears of the Church watch over the Princess' slumber, and this serves as proof of their fulfillment of their duty. The embellished gold cloth is woven with a crest of young grass.
The Princess' knights proudly displayed these precious favors, which were most often seen swaying from their identical ceremonial spears.

Proof of a pact, employed by the Judicator Giant. Briefly summons the eccentric Silver Knight Ledo.
Most bound by the Judicator's pact are not willing but rather impelled. Yet a rare few are linked to the giant by mutual friendship.
This is a precious corroboration of such amiability, and the only one that manifested in physical form.

Online play item. A fragment of the matching ritual spears once held by the knights of Princess Filianore.
They are the namesake of the Spears of the Church.
When Spears of the Church face unduly treacherous foes, this allows them to draw upon former majesty, and summon a row of upward-thrusting ritual spears.

Online play item. A fragment of the matching ritual spears once held by the knights of Princess Filianore.
These Divine Spears of gold were placed in the trusted hands of exalted Spears.
When Spears of the Church face unduly treacherous foes, this allows them to draw upon former majesty, and summon a row of upward-thrusting ritual spears.

Soul of Slave Knight Gael. One of the twisted souls, steeped in strength.
The red-hooded, wandering slave knight Gael sought the blood of the dark soul as pigment for the Painted World. But Gael knew he was no Champion, that the dark soul would likely ruin him, and that he had little hope of a safe return.

Soul of the demon prince. One of the twisted souls, steeped in strength.
The demons, birthed from a common Chaos, share almost everything between them, even the pride of their prince, and his near-faded flame.
So that the last demon standing may rekindle it.

Soul of Darkeater Midir. One of the twisted souls, steeped in strength.
Midir, descendant of Archdragons, was raised by the gods, and owing to his immortality, was given a duty to eternally battle the dark, a duty that he would never forget, even after the gods perished.

The small banner used by envoys of Great Lord Gwyn in the days of yore.
Face the ringed cliff and hold the banner high to summon facilitators of transport.
For the pygmies, who took the dark soul, the Great Lord gifted the Ringed City, an isolated place at world's end, and his beloved youngest daughter, promising her that he would come for her when the day came.

Umbral ash of the old stone-humped woman. With this, the shrine handmaid will prepare new items.
Things that have dreadfully run their course accrue at the great dreg-heap. This old woman was once the wet nurse of royalty.

Blood of the dark soul that seeped from the hole within Slave Knight Gael.
Used as pigment by his lady in Ariandel to depict a painted world.
When Gael came upon the pygmy lords, he discovered that their blood had long ago dried, and so consumed the dark soul.

A small, transparent stone that once graced the green young grass crest.
This semi-precious gem honors a Spear of Church after a battle well-fought, and is said to slightly enhance their blessing of protection.
Grants additional HP, Stamina recovery and boosts damage absorption for a short duration.

A memory of an old sword found deep within Midir. This sorcery uses souls to grant form to the thought, and attack with it.
Attacks are coupled with lightwaves, and sustaining the stance before attacking increases their speed and potency.
The sword is named after moonlight, but it is slightly different than the one fashioned of the paledrake Seath. Perhaps it is rooted in an older memory, from not long after the Beginning.

A memory of an old sword found deep within Midir. This sorcery uses souls to grant form to the thought, and attack with it.
Attacks are coupled with lightwaves, and sustaining the stance before attacking increases their speed and potency.
Increases Poise Damage to 100.
The sword is named after moonlight, but it is slightly different than the one fashioned of the paledrake Seath. Perhaps it is rooted in an older memory, from not long after the Beginning.

Pyromancy of Zoey, descendant of the desert pyromancers.
Use repeatedly to brush the fan of flame left and right.
Zoey possessed true beauty, as did all the desert pyromancers, but hers did not poison, and so she became the unassuming queen of the feeble ones.

Pyromancy of Zoey, descendant of the desert pyromancers.
Use repeatedly to brush the fan of flame left and right. Can be used with no focus cost.
Zoey possessed true beauty, as did all the desert pyromancers, but hers did not poison, and so she became the unassuming queen of the feeble ones.

The last flame lit by the demon prince. This pyromancy hurls a clump of chaos.
Upon impact, this clump of chaos seethes wildly, condenses briefly, then explodes violently.
To the demons, these clumps are shreds of life.

The last flame lit by the demon prince. This pyromancy hurls a clump of chaos.
Upon impact, this clump of chaos seethes wildly, condenses briefly, then explodes violently. Increases Poise Damage to 100.
To the demons, these clumps are shreds of life.

The few female knights who served in the age of the gods used this miracle for dragonslaying.
Draw lightning bow to fire a lightning arrow.
The lightning arrows offer a great improvement to the range of spears, and were said to have been used to pierce the eyes of dragons from afar. But remember, beautiful stories are always marked by embellishment.

The few female knights who served in the age of the gods used this miracle for dragonslaying.
Draw lightning bow to fire a lightning arrow with no focus cost.
The lightning arrows offer a great improvement to the range of spears, and were said to have been used to pierce the eyes of dragons from afar. But remember, beautiful stories are always marked by embellishment.

A miracle discovered in the last days of Lothric.
Toss a light that heals 300 HP for those near the point of impact. Scales with Spell Buff.
Even those who had forgotten the caress and bounty of the Princess of Sunlight did their best to recall her image. The stories spun about her were most certainly childish, and yet gravely sincere.

A miracle discovered in the last days of Lothric.
Toss a light that heals 300 HP for those near the point of impact. Scales with Spell Buff. Range increased to 5 meters.
Even those who had forgotten the caress and bounty of the Princess of Sunlight did their best to recall her image. The stories spun about her were most certainly childish, and yet gravely sincere.
